PlantCV: Plant Image Analysis Software


For for more information, documentation, and download of PlantCV go here

PlantCV is an imaging processing package specific for plants that is built upon open-source software platforms OpenCV 1, NumPy 2, and MatPlotLib 3. PlantCV was created at the Donald Danforth Plant Science Center in 2014. Please check back for new functions and tutorials. To more quickly serve your questions and issues please post them HERE</p>

If you use PlantCV please cite: paper here

More on the PlantCV Development Team:
Noah Fahlgren, USDA-NIFA Postdoctoral Fellow Follow @NoahFahlgren
Max Feldman, USDA Postdoctoral Researcher Follow @maxjfeldman
Malia Gehan, NSF-PGRP Postdoctoral Fellow Follow @maliadong

Citations:

  1. Bradski G (2000) The opencv library. Doctor Dobbs Journal 25(11):120-126.
  2. Oliphant TE (2007) Python for Scientific Computing. Computing in Science & Engineering, 9, 10-20.
  3. Hunter JD (2007) Matplotlib: A 2D graphics environment. Computing in Science & Engineering, 9, 90-95.

About

The Maker Group at the Donald Danforth Plant Science Center is a forum for all members of the Center to explore constructing low-cost hardware and software engineering tools.
